desmoj.core.simulator

Class Schedulable

  • java.lang.Object
    • desmoj.core.simulator.NamedObject
      • desmoj.core.simulator.ModelComponent
        • desmoj.core.simulator.Schedulable
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Entity, EventAbstract

    public class Schedulable
extends ModelComponent
    All objects that want to be handled by the scheduler must extend this class. These are events (including external events), entities and SimProcesses. All functionality common to Schedulable objects are encapsulated here.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.List<EventNote> _schedule
      A list containing all scheduled entries for this Schedulable in future.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Constructs a Schedulable object with the given name.

      Removes all events scheduled for this entity from the event-list.

      Shows if this Schedulable is the currently active object.

      Tests if this entity has already been scheduled.
      void rename(java.lang.String newName)
      Allows to rename a Schedulable object while keeping its internally added serial number to keep track of the individual object.
      void reSchedule(SimTime dt)
      Deprecated. 
      Use reSchedule(TimeSpan dt). Re-schedules the Schedulable at some other point in simulation time than it already had been scheduled before.
      void reSchedule(TimeInstant time)
      Re-schedules the Schedulable to some other point in simulation time (which should be different form the instant at which is a scheduled at the moment).
      void reSchedule(TimeSpan dt)
      Re-schedules the Schedulable by shifting all EventNote by a specified TimeSpan.
      TimeInstant scheduledAt()
      Deprecated. 
      Returns the point of simulation time this Schedulable is scheduled at. Returns null, if the entity has not been scheduled and thus can not return an appropriate point of simulation time. Use scheduleNext() for next TimeInstant where an event-note lists this entity.
      TimeInstant scheduledNext()
      Returns the next point of time this entity is scheduled.

    • Field Detail

      • _schedule

        protected java.util.List<EventNote> _schedule
        A list containing all scheduled entries for this Schedulable in future.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Schedulable

        public Schedulable(Model owner,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   boolean showInTrace)
        Constructs a Schedulable object with the given name. Note that to identify the multiple objects that can be created of one type of Schedulable, each has a unique number added to its name as a suffix. The numbers represent the amount of objects being created with the same name.
        Parameters:
        name - java.lang.String : The name of the new Schedulable object
        owner - Model : The owner of this Schedulable object

    • Method Detail

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Removes all events scheduled for this entity from the event-list. The Entity will not become active until scheduled again.

      • isCurrent

        public boolean isCurrent()
        Shows if this Schedulable is the currently active object.
        Returns:
        boolean :true if this Schedulable is the currently active, false otherwise

      • isScheduled

        public boolean isScheduled()
        Tests if this entity has already been scheduled.
        Returns:
        boolean :true if already scheduled, false otherwise

      • rename

        public void rename(java.lang.String newName)
        Allows to rename a Schedulable object while keeping its internally added serial number to keep track of the individual object. Note that invalid string parameters will result in renaming the Schedulable to 'unnamed'.
        Overrides:
        rename in class NamedObject
        Parameters:
        newName - java.lang.String : The Schedulable's new name

      • reSchedule

        public void reSchedule(TimeSpan dt)
        Re-schedules the Schedulable by shifting all EventNote by a specified TimeSpan.
        Parameters:
        dt - TimeSpan : The offset to the current simulation time at which this Schedulable is to be re-scheduled

      • reSchedule

        public void reSchedule(TimeInstant time)
        Re-schedules the Schedulable to some other point in simulation time (which should be different form the instant at which is a scheduled at the moment).
        Parameters:
        time - TimeInstant : The simulation time at which this entity is to be re-scheduled

      • reSchedule

        public void reSchedule(SimTime dt)
        Deprecated. Use reSchedule(TimeSpan dt). Re-schedules the Schedulable at some other point in simulation time than it already had been scheduled before.
        Parameters:
        dt - TimeSpan : The offset to the current simulation time at which this Schedulable is to be re-scheduled

      • scheduledAt

        public TimeInstant scheduledAt()
        Deprecated. Returns the point of simulation time this Schedulable is scheduled at. Returns null, if the entity has not been scheduled and thus can not return an appropriate point of simulation time. Use scheduleNext() for next TimeInstant where an event-note lists this entity.
        Returns:
        TimeInstant : The point of simulation time this Schedulable is scheduled at or null otherwise

      • scheduledNext

        public TimeInstant scheduledNext()
        Returns the next point of time this entity is scheduled.
        Returns:
        TimeInstant : The point of simulation time the next Entity is schedule or null otherwise

      • clone

        protected Schedulable clone()
                     throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Creates and returns a copy of this Schedulable. Note that subclasses have to implement the interface java.lang.Cloneable to actually use this method as otherwise, a CloneNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Schedulable : A copy of this Schedulable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
